remarks.para: If you create an instance of the target class for the first time, the weaver creates an interwoven type which is the target class interwoven with all aspects. Subsequent calls requesting instances of the same target class will return instances of the same interwoven type. If an aspect does not match a join-point of the target class, the aspect will not be interwoven to the target class. The weaver uses a defined interweaving order to interweave more than one aspect.
To prevent ambigous matches having multiple construcors in the targettype class use the to specify the right constructor.

Both overloaded methods and aren't lock-free. If a thread is creating an interwoven object for the first time, all concurrent calls to these methods are blocked until the object is created. If you want to avoid this behaviour, use a class factory by calling . If the first object of a type was created, all subsequent calls for creating objects of the same type will not block anymore.
These methods are only available if you use dynamic weaving with Rapier-LOOM.NET.

createremarks.exception: The aspect weaver was unable to interweave the target class.
The interwoven target class has is still abstract methods.
There is no constructor that matches the specified parameters.
